# Offline Budget Tracker

[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)

## Table of Contents
* [Description](#description)
* [Lessons Learned](#lessons-learned)
* [Credits](#credits)
* [Tools](#tools)
* [How to Contribute](#how-to-contribute)
* [License](#license)
* [Questions](#questions)
## Description 
This application allows the user to track income and expenses through a progressive web application. While in use, if the application goes offline, the user can still input budget items and use the application. When online, the bugdet items will get entered into the mongo database. 
By allowing this application to work offline, and by making this a PWA, the access for the user improves significantly. 

## Lessons Learned
In building this application, I learned a lot more about utilizing indexedDB, webpack, setting up a service worker, and a webmanifest. 
### Demo

  <video width="auto" height="400" controls>

  </video>

### Deployed Application

https://offline-budget-tracker-019.herokuapp.com/
  
## Credits
The application was setup without the PWA and offline functionality by UW Bootcamp.
